# kakaocloud_kubernetes_engine_versions (Data Source)

The `kakaocloud_kubernetes_engine_versions` data source retrieves the list of supported Kubernetes versions in
KakaoCloud Kubernetes Engine.

This data source is useful when you need to:

- List all available Kubernetes versions for creating or upgrading clusters.
- Check version details such as minor versions, patch versions, and next upgrade paths.
- Identify deprecated versions or versions approaching end-of-life (EOL).
- Dynamically reference supported Kubernetes versions in Terraform without hardcoding values.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Copyright (c) HashiCorp, Inc.
# SPDX-License-Identifier: MPL-2.0

# List all supported Kubernetes versions
data "kakaocloud_kubernetes_engine_versions" "all" {
  # No arguments required
}

# Output all available Kubernetes versions
output "all_k8s_versions" {
  description = "List of all supported Kubernetes versions in KakaoCloud"
  value = {
    count          = length(data.kakaocloud_kubernetes_engine_versions.all.versions)
    minor_versions = data.kakaocloud_kubernetes_engine_versions.all.versions[*].minor_version
    patch_versions = data.kakaocloud_kubernetes_engine_versions.all.versions[*].patch_version
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->

## Argument Reference

- `timeouts` (Optional, Attributes) Custom timeout settings. (See [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--timeouts).)

## Attribute Reference

The following attributes are exported:

- `versions` (Attributes List) List of supported Kubernetes versions. (
  see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--versions))

<a id="nestedatt--timeouts"></a>

### Nested Schema for `timeouts`

- `read` (Optional, String) A string that can be [parsed as a duration](https://pkg.go.dev/time#ParseDuration)
  consisting of numbers and unit suffixes, such as "30s" or "2h45m". Valid time units are "s" (seconds), "m" (
  minutes), "h" (hours).

<a id="nestedatt--versions"></a>

### Nested Schema for `versions`

- `eol` (String) End-of-life (EOL) date of the Kubernetes version.
- `is_deprecated` (Boolean) Indicates whether the version is deprecated.
- `minor_version` (String) Minor version number (e.g., 1.28).
- `next_version` (String) Next available upgrade target version.
- `patch_version` (String) Patch version number (e.g., 1.28.3).
